intro: Nepeta tuberosa f. pallescens, commonly known as the pale catmint, is a cultivar of the catmint plant native to Europe. It is characterized by its pale blue to silver-gray flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and as a nectar source for pollinators. The leaves are hairy and emit a minty scent when crushed, contributing to its aromatic profile.
